metadata.Title: CVE-2013-6639 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The DehoistArrayIndex function in hydrogen-dehoist.cc (aka hydrogen.cc) in Google V8 before 3.22.24.7, as used in Google Chrome before 31.0.1650.63, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds write) or possibly have unspecified other impact via JavaScript code that sets the value of an array element with a crafted index.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-6639` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 31.0.1650.63-0ubuntu1~20131204.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 31.0.1650.63-0ubuntu1~20131204.1
chromium-chromedriver - 31.0.1650.63-0ubuntu1~20131204.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 31.0.1650.63-0ubuntu1~20131204.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 31.0.1650.63-0ubuntu1~20131204.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

libv8-3.14.5 - 3.14.5.8-5ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '31.0.1650.63-0ubuntu1~20131204.1').
libv8-3.14 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.14.5.8-5ubuntu1').
